trends: There have been 136 other sightings in Toronto
There was one other sighting in Toronto on or around July 1st 2010
divs: sighting detailsobserved object while seated in the backyard of a residence, on an outdoor patio with a small group (8 people) of family and friends object appeared directly overhead as the only bright object in the night sky, many times larger than any known star or satellite (perhaps 3-4 times larger than the planet venus on a clear night, and one quarter the size of a full moon) given the day and time of sighting (early evening of july 1, canada day, 2010), first thought it might be a firework\rocket released in the neighborhood initially surprised, then puzzled as to the absence of any sound or trail behind the object, then curious about the possible size and altitude of the object, then anxious to snap a photograph using a cell phone camera, then frustrated at not being able to open the camera before the object disappeared beyond the horizon discussed the incident with other observers on the patio as the object passed overhead, and then afterwards wondering if we might hear something about it on the news the next day, hearing nothing from the news, tried unsuccessfully to research the flight path of the international space station, but learned from on-line research that the relative size of the iss in orbit was much smaller that the size of the object in question orange\red regular circular-shaped object glowing steadily, no blinking or flashing lights, moving slowly in a straight line across the sky from north to south, no tail or trail of any kind size of object comparable to the size of one's pinky fingernail held at arms length away from the eye object was in constant view for approx. 60-90 seconds, from the time of first sighting when it appeared almost directly overhead until the time it disappeared over the southern horizon moving slowly and steadily across the night sky, similar to an aircraft transiting at high altitude difficult to determine altitude and speed of the object without knowing size ... if it had been the size of a commercial airliner (airbus, or similar), it is estimated that it might have been around 10,000-15,000 feet high ... if it was the size of a small, private aircraft or helicopter (cessna 150, or similar), it is estimated that it might have been around 1,000-2,000 feet high observer is a retired air force pilot with extensive training and experience in most aspects of military\civilian aerospace operations this is the observer's first sighting of an unidentified flying object event
Summary: As one of 7 witnesses, observed a brightly glowing red/orange circular object, moving slowly/silently across the night sky, disappearing beyond the horizon.
